location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Coll 29/56 'Duzdap: question of retention of vice consulates'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the inside front cover with 1, and terminates at the last folio with 123; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file concerns the British Vice-Consulate at Duzdap [Zahedan, Iran].The file contains correspondence related to:creation of the Vice-Consulate in 1928 to be retained until 1931, with further extensions until 1933, 1935, and 1936taxation of the area occupied by the Vice-Consulate, 1935claim of Iranian Government for paying of registration dues and land taxes in respect of the Vice-Consulate property, 1935supply of a new safe at the Vice-Consulate, 1937proposed retention of Vice-Consulate on a permanent basis, 1936reconstruction and repair of Vice-Consulate buildings at Zahedan and water supply, 1942.The file is composed of correspondence between the Government of India; the Secretary of State for India; the Foreign Office; the British Legation at Tehran; the British Consulate for Khorassan; the Iranian Ministry of Foreign Affairs; and the India Office.

name.namePart: Secretary of State for India, United Kingdom
Secretary of State for India and Burma, United Kingdom
